Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different plants and animals (including humans) in their natural habitats.
The student can illustrate the specific places where each plant or animal lives, such as water, forests, fields, or sunny areas.
The student can show what resources the plants and animals need to survive, like water, sunlight, or food sources like leaves and grass.
The student can demonstrate how plants and animals use the resources from their environment to meet their needs.
The student can show how different parts of the natural world work together as a system to provide what living things need.
